alert.note: Alert for Elk (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 29 at 11:05PM CDT until April 29 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT FOR ELK...NORTHEASTERN COWLEY AND SOUTHEASTERN GREENWOOD COUNTIES... At 1104 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fall River to near Atlanta, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Howard, Moline, Severy, Grenola, Fall River, Elk Falls, Climax, Fall River Lake, Piedmont and Fall River State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
